DataElement.preferredName: PROMIS Adult Physical Health Physical Function PFA11  Ability to do Vacuuming and Yardwork Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated response of the difficulty they have with doing chores such as vacuuming or yard work, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: PROMIS Adult Physical Health Domain Physical Function Ability to do Vacuuming and Yardwork Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) domain that assesses the status of an individual's physical health._The collection of PROMIS item scales that assess an individual's ability to carry out activities that require physical actions including more complex activities that require a combination of skills, often within a social context._A question about the ability of an individual to do chores such as vacuuming and yardwork._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredName: PROMIS Ability Difficulty Score 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used with the PROMIS items that describes a range of subjective scores from 1: Unable to do, to 5: Without any difficulty.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something without any difficulty.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something without any difficulty.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something with a little difficulty.

Concepts.longName: Can Do With a Little Difficulty
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something with a little difficulty.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something with some difficulty.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something with some difficulty.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something with much difficulty.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something with much difficulty.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is unable to do something.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is unable to do something.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are you able to do chores such as vacuuming or yard work?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring and Interpretation Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scoring and Interpretation materials are available from the PROMIS Assessment Center.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.
